page.title: 07Farming in SW.Cheshire(2)
page.content: Farms may be large but farm workers are few e.g.Hatton farm has 3;Hatton Hall farm 3;Coldharbour Farm 1 & 1 part-timer (the farmer's wife) this being the only farm in the area to be part of a co-operative.The co-op helps with low interest loans for machines, offers advice etc.Farms may buy in winter feed but some grow cereals & all grow hay & silage the latter often stored under plastic sheets weighted with old tyres.The Grosvenor Estate grows rapeseed in large quantities, mainly for fodder & by the A41 road 2 small fields of sweet corn,unripe even in September after a particularly cold & wet summer must also be for fodder. Small areas of waste land are along a disused branch railway line,in Platts Lane where an old marl pit is being in-filled with rubble from roadworks & in a field in the NW.by the canal.
